citeinfo.title: New York City Building Roof Elevations, 2002

descript.abstract: Sanborn CitySets New York City Building Roof Elevations is a polygon theme representing roof elevations for selected structures in parts of Manhattan and Brooklyn. There may be multiple polygons for single buildings with the same BLDGID.
descript.purpose: For use in building 3D building models.
descript.supplinf: Building heights are measured at the highest point of the roof over habitable space. The distance is measured in feet from the building height to the average ground level around the building. The average ground level is accurate within five feet. At least one building height is placed on each building. Residential buildings have only one point measured for each building polygon at the highest occupy-able rooftop. Ninety percent of the building height measurements shall be within five feet of the true height of the measured point. The building height calculation, therefore, is accurate within 10 feet 90 percent of the time. Commercial buildings (as interpreted by the photogrammetry technician) and any building over eight stories tall have a point measured for each rooftop breakline polygon. A rooftop breakline shall be placed where there is a change in elevation of three stories (33 feet) or more. HVAC units, chimneys, antennas, and similar features are not be taken into consideration when placing these breaklines.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

horizpa.horizpar: Data meets National Map Accuracy Standards (90 percent accurate to within 3.33 feet of true ground position)

vertacc.vertaccr: Ninety percent of the building height measurements shall be within five feet of the true height of the measured point. The building height calculation, therefore, is accurate within 10 feet 90 percent of the time.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Average highest elevation of the roof above that polygon.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
